pipes.name: FakeTranslatePipe

interfaces.name: EdcPopoverConfiguration
interfaces.description:
Popover global configuration, to provide when importing the edc help module

pluginId: URL to the help web app.
helpPath: URL to the HTTP served export.
docPath: Export plugin name for the edc documentation.
i18nDirName: Path to the i18n files, containing the labels
options: Popover global options, to apply to all popovers

interfaces.name: HelpModuleConfig
IEdcPopoverOptions

injectables.name: ConfigService
EdcTranslationService

methods.name: getPopoverLabels
methods.description:
Returns the popover labels from the i18n files in the publication export

If an error occurred or no translations were returned, returns default labels

methods.name: loadDefaultLabels
methods.description: Load default popover labels on error

injectables.name: HelpConfigService

methods.name: addIconToConfig
methods.description: Builds the icon configuration from the given options

methods.name: addOptions
methods.description: Merges and saves options in the configuration respecting priorities from the different sources. In order - higher levels will overwrite the lower ones : Default options < global options < single popover input options

methods.name: buildPopoverConfig
methods.description:
Creates the popover configuration to generate the icon and the popover elements

Relies on the edc-client-js to retrieve the help content and the labels from the export Adds the given options (placement, style, behavior...) Prepares the icon configuration

If an error occurs, generates an error configuration for a icon / popover, based on the fail behavior options.

methods.name: getIconClasses
methods.description: Returns the classes to use for the popover icon

methods.name: handleError
methods.description:
Intercepts help errors, from the client-js or from a content error

Resolves options, and sends the error to the helpErrorService

jsdoctags.comment: the options initially passed to the popover
the language to use, for the labels

methods.name: resolveOptions
methods.description:
Resolves the options to use, mixing the 3 levels: - Populate with default options - Overwrites with the global options properties, if defined - Overwrites with popover level options, passed to this particular popover instance

Skip any undefined property

injectables.name: HelpErrorService

methods.name: buildErrorConfig
methods.description: Builds the configuration object for the error popover

methods.name: buildErrorContent
methods.description: Builds the content for the error popover Based on fail behavior icon and popover options

jsdoctags.comment: the behavior options in case of error

methods.name: handleContentException
methods.description: Handles errors of type content error Creates the error popover, with labels and error

jsdoctags.comment: the options that were passed to the popover
the lang to use for the labels

methods.name: handleHelpError
methods.description: Handles errors and build a popover containing the error messages

jsdoctags.comment: the options that were passed to the popover initially

methods.name: handleOtherException
methods.description: Handles exceptions other than content exceptions

jsdoctags.comment: the options that were passed to the popover

injectables.name: HelpIconService

methods.name: buildErrorIconConfig
methods.description:
Builds a icon configuration for an error, based on the given options

Adjusts all the configuration values associated with the given icon behavior.

Behavior will define: icon: use the Error icon if Error behavior was set, else try to use the original icon's and if not present use default

icon style: - Shown: will display the normal icon
            - Error: will add the edc-icon-error class
            - Hidden: will add the edc-icon-hidden class
            - DISABLED: will add the edc-icon-disabled class

methods.name: buildIconClasses
methods.description:
Builds the icon classes from the popover options and icon properties

Icon can be set either from a css class (ie font-awesome: 'fa fa-question-circle-o'), or from an url. First checks if url is provided, and if it is use it to define the icon Only uses class if no url was found. That means that if both were provided, only the url will be used.

Will also set the dark mode adding it to the class list if dark option is true

jsdoctags.comment: the popover options object, containing the options for the icon

methods.name: buildIconConfig
methods.description:
Builds the configuration for the popover icon, based on resolved options

Generates: - icon: resolved icon properties from the options - iconTooltip: the icon tooltip - iconClasses: the icon main classes

jsdoctags.comment: the popover options from the received input

methods.name: buildPopoverIcon
methods.description:
Builds the icon options

Checks if at least one of the class or url properties should be defined If not, use default icon class

returns a safe PopoverIcon

methods.name: getIconClasses
methods.description:
Returns an array containing the class names for the icon, to pass to the angular ngClass directive

Looks for loaded classes in the icon configuration object Adds the error classes if this is a error popover

If no configuration was found, return an empty string

methods.name: getIconImageStyle
methods.description: Returns the css style declaration for the given icon image: - Sets the background image from url - Sets the width and height from the icon properties If width is not defined, uses height Uses Default values for properties if not defined

methods.name: getTooltip
methods.description:
Returns the tooltip for the icon, on hover Uses the 'iconAlt' property from the translated popover labels, provided by the the edc-client-js instance

returns an empty string if displayTooltip option is false, or if labels were not found

jsdoctags.comment: true if tooltip should be displayed (from the popover options)
the translated labels containing the text for the tooltip

injectables.name: HelpPopoverService

methods.name: addContent
methods.description:
Adds the popover content

throws a ContentNotFoundError if helper is not defined

jsdoctags.comment: the edc helper that will request the content using the edc-client-js instance

methods.name: addLabels
methods.description: Adds labels into the popover configuration

methods.name: parseUrls
methods.description: Sets the url attributes for links and articles to open in the web help explorer, inserting the help path defined in the global configuration

jsdoctags.comment: the identifier of the published export the keys belong to

injectables.name: HelpService
PopoverConfigHandler

classes.name: AppPage
ContentNotFoundError
EdcConfiguration
classes.description: Class representing the config.json object in assets folder.
classes.rawdescription: Class representing the config.json object in assets folder.

classes.name: EdcPopoverOptions
classes.description:
Options for the angular-ng popover, extending edc-popover-utils options

failBehavior: icon and popover behavior when an error occurs dark: dark mode icon: properties for the popover icon
classes.rawdescription:
Options for the angular-ng popover, extending edc-popover-utils options

failBehavior: icon and popover behavior when an error occurs
dark: dark mode
icon: properties for the popover icon

classes.name: FailBehavior
IconConfig
classes.description: Holds the configuration for the target: - icon: configuration for the popover icon (also referred as the target) - iconTooltip: Tooltip to show on hover over the icon - iconClasses: Array that holds the class names to apply to the icon - imageStyle: CSS style to apply to the icon element - errorClasses: the classes to attach to the icon if an error occurred
classes.rawdescription:
Holds the configuration for the target:
    - icon: configuration for the popover icon (also referred as the target)
    - iconTooltip: Tooltip to show on hover over the icon
    - iconClasses: Array that holds the class names to apply to the icon
    - imageStyle: CSS style to apply to the icon element
    - errorClasses: the classes to attach to the icon if an error occurred

classes.name: IconPopoverConfig
classes.description:
Configuration for both icon and the popover itself Extends the edc-popover-utils configuration. Holds the configuration for the edc-popover-utils, along with other properties necessary for the edc-client-ng1

- iconConfig: Configuration for the icon: classes, style, url...
- disablePopover: Defines popover current disabled state
- labels: Translated labels from the i18n files returned by the edc help client
classes.rawdescription:
Configuration for both icon and the popover itself
Extends the edc-popover-utils configuration.
Holds the configuration for the edc-popover-utils, along with other properties necessary for the edc-client-ng1

    - iconConfig: Configuration for the icon: classes, style, url...
    - disablePopover: Defines popover current disabled state
    - labels: Translated labels from the i18n files returned by the edc help client

classes.name: PopoverConfig
PopoverConfigurationHandler
PopoverIcon
classes.description:
Input icon properties received with the options

- class: the class name for the icon
- url: image URL - if present, the class property will be ignored
- height: url image Height in pixels, (for url images only)
- width: Width in pixels: if height is not defined, height value will be applied
- errorClass: Classes to use if an error occurred
classes.rawdescription:
Input icon properties received with the options

    - class: the class name for the icon
    - url: image URL - if present, the class property will be ignored
    - height: url image Height in pixels, (for url images only)
    - width: Width in pixels: if height is not defined, height value will be applied
    - errorClass: Classes to use if an error occurred

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a popover icon with default values

directives.name: HelpPopoverDirective

components.name: AppComponent
components.template:
Welcome to {{title}}!

Click on the help icon to display help contents.

Select the language
If content for the selected language is not available in the exported documentation, it will load default

Many options available!

Icon from: URL
Custom class name:
Dark mode
Open on hover, with some delay
Animations

Error state options

Change the icon and popover appearance, content and behavior on error
Friendly message
Error message
No popover
Hidden icon

More options at edc-popover-ng

propertiesClass.name: failOptions2
failOptionsErrorIcon
failOptionsHidden
friendlyMessage

components.sourceCode:
import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { Animation, AnimationType, DEFINED_TRANSLATION_CODES, IconBehavior, IEdcPopoverOptions, LANGUAGE_CODES, PopoverBehavior } from 'edc-popover-ng'; import { PopoverPlacement } from 'edc-popover-utils'; @Component({ selector: 'edc-root', template: `

Welcome to {{title}}!

Click on the help icon to display help contents.

Select the language
If content for the selected language is not available in the exported documentation, it will load default

Many options available!

Icon from: URL
Custom class name:
Dark mode
Open on hover, with some delay
Animations

Error state options

Change the icon and popover appearance, content and behavior on error
Friendly message
Error message
No popover
Hidden icon

More options at edc-popover-ng

`, styleUrls: ['./app.component.less'] }) export class AppComponent { title = 'edc-popover-ng demo'; lang = 'en'; languages = LANGUAGE_CODES; animation: Animation = AnimationType.SHIFT_AWAY_EXTREME; animations = Object.values(AnimationType); iconBehavior = IconBehavior; popoverBehavior = PopoverBehavior; friendlyMessage: IEdcPopoverOptions = { placement: PopoverPlacement.BOTTOM_START, customClass: 'my-popover', failBehavior: { icon: IconBehavior.SHOWN, popover: PopoverBehavior.ERROR_SHOWN }, animation: AnimationType.SHIFT_AWAY_EXTREME }; failOptions2: IEdcPopoverOptions = { placement: PopoverPlacement.BOTTOM_START, customClass: 'my-popover', dark: true, failBehavior: { icon: IconBehavior.SHOWN, popover: PopoverBehavior.FRIENDLY_MSG } }; failOptionsErrorIcon: IEdcPopoverOptions = { placement: PopoverPlacement.BOTTOM_START, customClass: 'my-popover', dark: true, failBehavior: { icon: IconBehavior.ERROR, popover: PopoverBehavior.ERROR_SHOWN } }; failOptionsHidden: IEdcPopoverOptions = { placement: PopoverPlacement.BOTTOM_START, failBehavior: { icon: IconBehavior.SHOWN, popover: PopoverBehavior.NO_POPOVER } }; isTranslationDefined(language: string): boolean { return DEFINED_TRANSLATION_CODES.indexOf(language) > -1; } }

components.name: HelpComponent

variables.name: copyDefinedProperties
variables.defaultValue:
<T>(target: T, src: T): T => {
  if (!isObject(target)) {
    return null;
  }
  // Create a shallow copy of the target
  const newTarget = Object.assign({}, target);
  if (!isObject(src)) {
    return newTarget;
  }
  // Copying the defined ones into the new target object
  return Object.keys(src)
    .reduce<T>((memo: T, key: string) => {
      // Copy values from src into target only if they are defined
      if (src.hasOwnProperty(key) && !isNil(src[key])) {
        memo[key] = src[key];
      }
      return memo;
    }, newTarget);
}
variables.description:
Copies the defined source properties into the given object, skipping any null or undefined values in the source object.

Does not modify target, create a new shallow copy of the target If source is null or a primitive, returns a shallow copy of target If target is null or a primitive, returns null even if source is defined

variables.name: isFalse
variables.description: Check if value is defined and false

variables.name: isNil
variables.description:
Returns true if a value is null or undefined

Obs: worth remembering that null is of type 'object' while undefined is of type 'undefined' And null is only loosely equal to itself and undefined, not to the other falsy values

variables.name: isObject
variables.defaultValue: (obj: any): boolean => typeof obj === 'object' && obj !== null
variables.description: Returns true if value is an object not null
